function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Perceived status changes between rounds"},{"name":"Preparedness ratings for handling the impact of covid-19"},{"name":"Correlation analyses used to evaluate association between quantitative variables"},{"name":"No statistically significant difference in impact score between rounds in group a"},{"name":"Higher average scores for software and hardware in group a compared to group b may indicate unequal access to technology for remote work."},{"name":"Differences in the perceived impact of covid-19 on the construction industry between group a and group b may reflect variations in experiences and perspectives related to the pandemic."},{"name":"Participants from different countries with varying levels of impact from covid-19"},{"name":"Decreased working time for group b participants in the initial survey round"},{"name":"Changes in remote work capabilities over survey rounds"},{"name":"Utilizing a small sample size of 97 subjects may lead to a lack of generalizability of the findings."},{"name":"Collecting survey responses during the covid-19 pandemic may introduce bias due to the impact of the pandemic on respondents’ perspectives and behaviors."},{"name":"Using a cross-sectional approach may overlook the dynamic nature of the covid-19 situation, leading to limited insights into longitudinal changes."},{"name":"Construction professionals may have varied perceptions of the covid-19 impact on construction, leading to a lack of consensus in response planning."},{"name":"Global and regional differences in perceived impacts of covid-19 on construction may lead to localized response plans that do not account for broader patterns of disease propagation."},{"name":"Perceptions of professionals at different points in time may not accurately reflect the evolving nature of the pandemic, leading to outdated response plans."},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases in supply chains"},{"name":"Ambiguity and inconsistencies in covid-19 statistics due to economic expediencies and ambiguous behavior of the virus"},{"name":"Disruption of construction projects due to epidemics"},{"name":"Financial losses in construction companies"},{"name":"Financial strain on self-employed individuals due to lockdowns"},{"name":"Decline in immigrant workers impacting construction projects"},{"name":"Differences in perception of pandemic impact between developed and developing countries"},{"name":"Adverse effects of covid-19 on the global economy"},{"name":"Risks and adverse effects of covid-19 on tunnel construction sites"},{"name":"Impact of pandemic on construction professionals’ performance"},{"name":"Construction professionals interacting with covid-19"},{"name":"Multiple rounds of surveys conducted with construction professionals"},{"name":"Lack of critical reflexivity in urban soundscapes research"},{"name":"Tightly controlled production environment may lead to a false sense of security and neglect of potential risks."},{"name":"Sampling strategy targeting a particular group may limit the representation of diverse experiences and perspectives."},{"name":"International collaboration involving 25 academics creates potential for transmission of contagious diseases across borders."},{"name":"Podcasting project involves close contact between academics, increasing the risk of transmitting contagious diseases within the academic community."},{"name":"Attentiveness to non-human others and the more-than-human city"},{"name":"Familiarity with lockdown measures leading to complacency"},{"name":"Global circulation of covid-19"},{"name":"Lack of social distancing in suburban streets due to increased pedestrian, jogger, and cyclist activity"},{"name":"Crowdfunding and volunteer delivery services increasing physical interaction and potential exposure to the virus"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and consideration for front-line workers in essential businesses"},{"name":"Frequent references to the visceral experience of being in the city under covid-19."},{"name":"People hoarding essential supplies such as toilet paper"},{"name":"Inability to gather in public spaces leading to new ways of social interaction"},{"name":"Lack of representation of embodied sounds and communication in scholarly journals"},{"name":"Marginalized people being more physically visible and exposed in cities during the pandemic"},{"name":"Inequitable access to technology and education impacting ability to understand and share experiences during the pandemic"},{"name":"Covid-19 disproportionately affecting vulnerable populations"},{"name":"Overpopulated slums at high risk due to virus"},{"name":"Economic breakdown in iran due to sanctions"},{"name":"Transmission of contagious diseases in crowded cities due to interactions in social and professional settings."},{"name":"Presence of coyotes in downtown-adjacent neighborhood"},{"name":"Change in urban soundscape due to covid-19"}]}
